meanings.definition: The process of turning something into pulp.
meanings.sent1: The pulping of the fruits was done to make delicious juice.
meanings.sent2: The factory's pulping of old newspapers helps in recycling.
meanings.sent3: The pulping of the homework assignment made it easier to recycle.
meanings.sent4: The pulping of the enemy's defenses allowed for an easy victory.
meanings.sent5: The pulping of the wood created a soft material for crafting.

meanings.definition: The act of reducing something to a soft, wet mass.
meanings.sent1: The pulping of the vegetables made a tasty soup.
meanings.sent2: Heavy rain caused the pulping of the fallen leaves on the ground.
meanings.sent3: The pulping of the ice cream made it easier to eat quickly.
meanings.sent4: The pulping of the clay turned it into a moldable material.
meanings.sent5: The pulping of the paper in water created a mushy mess.

meanings.definition: The action of crushing or grinding something into a pulp.
meanings.sent1: The pulping of the seeds produced a fine powder for cooking.
meanings.sent2: The pulping of the grapes is essential in winemaking.
meanings.sent3: The pulping of the candy made it easier to chew.
meanings.sent4: The pulping of the herbs released their flavors for the dish.
meanings.sent5: The pulping of the rocks created a smooth surface over time.
